title: Font with a LOOOPY "W".
content:
I have been looking EVERYWHERE for this font and just can't find it.  
It is the font with the loppy W in "weekend" or "whale"  
I contacted a couple of people on Etsy who use it on their products and 1 hasn't responded yet and the other said, "I don't share fonts". So that made me even more determined to find it! :)

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317201335im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bachfont1_6522.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317201335im_/http:/typophile.com/files/fontfind_3590.jpg)

SOLVED!

Font: 

 Wish I Were Taller 

Solved By: 

 [kthomps5](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317201335/http:/typophile.com/user/175823 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bachfont1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317201335/http:/typophile.com/files/bachfont1.jpg) | 59.14 KB |

author: sfaulds

comments.content:
Wish I Were Taller:

[http://www.kevinandamanda.com/fonts/freescrapbookfonts/wish-i-were-taller/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317201335/http:/www.kevinandamanda.com/fonts/freescrapbookfonts/wish-i-were-taller/ "http://www.kevinandamanda.com/fonts/freescrapbookfonts/wish-i-were-taller/")  
(free for personal use)

But I doubt they designed the font (I found several people on Deviant Art who appear to claim ownership and offer it for download).

Does anyone know if this is a rip-off of a legitimate, commercial font?
Ahh! Thank you so much! Did you just know that or did you do a search for it?! You just made my day!!!! :)
I used Whatfontis.com, which does a better job with freeware fonts.
